sql

Class SqlObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • sql.SqlObject

  • public class SqlObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages all querys and connections to the databases
    Author:
    Karsten Brandt, Martin Stoffers

    • Constructor Detail

      • SqlObject

        public SqlObject(java.lang.String server,
         int port,
         java.lang.String user,
         java.lang.String password,
         java.lang.String database,
         Options opt)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Instantiate a Database object with the given parameters. If database is empty the connection in connect is made without a table select.
        Parameters:
        server - Server which should be used (example.org)
        port - Port which should be used
        user - Username for authentication
        password - Password for authentication
        database - Database which should be used in every query
        opt - Options, which should be applied
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if driver is not found or database connection failed

      • SqlObject

        public SqlObject(java.lang.String server,
         java.lang.String user,
         java.lang.String password,
         java.lang.String database,
         Options opt)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Instantiate a Database object with the given parameters. If database is empty the connection in connect is made without a table select. Port will be set to standard SQL port
        Parameters:
        server - Server which should be used (example.org)
        user - Username for authentication
        password - Password for authentication
        database - Database which should be used in every query
        opt - Options, which should be applied
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if driver is not found or database connection failed

      • SqlObject

        public SqlObject(java.lang.String user,
         java.lang.String password,
         java.lang.String database,
         Options opt)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Instantiate a Database object with the given parameters. If database is empty the connection in connect is made without a table select. Port will be set to standard SQL port
        Parameters:
        user - Username for authentication
        password - Password for authentication
        database - Database which should be used in every query
        opt - Options, which should be applied
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if driver is not found or database connection failed

              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connects to Database with the given parameters from constructors Needs "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver" to work

        public void setNewServer(java.lang.String server)

        Throws:

        port - Port which should be used

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String query)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes a query to given server an if exists to a specific database
        Parameters:
        query - A String which contains the query
        Returns:
        Contains the result of the given query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if query failed

      • getSentences

        public SentenceList getSentences(int limit)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get a set of sentences from table sentences up to the given maximum in limit
        Parameters:
        limit - Limits the query to the given amount
        Returns:
        Contains the returned sentences
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if query failed

      • getSentences

        public SentenceList getSentences()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets the complete set of sentences from table sentences Table must exists in given database
        Returns:
        Contains the returned sentences
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if query failed

        public java.lang.String getSentenceById(int sentenceId)

        Parameters:
        sentenceId - is the Id of the desired sentence
        Returns:
        the sentence

      • isTableEmpty

        public boolean isTableEmpty(java.lang.String table)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Tests a given table to emptiness
        Parameters:
        table - The table, which should be tested
        Returns:
        Is true if table is empty, otherwise false will be returned
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if query failed

        public void insertWordCount(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> wordlist)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a given word list into the table word_frequency Table must exists in given database
        Parameters:
        wordlist - Hashmap with words and frequency count
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if query failed

                                throws java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        similarityMatrix - Matrix with similarities returned by SimilarityMatrix
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown, if query failed
